channel.title: Behance Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance

item.title: THE OUTPOST
item.description: The Outpost is a magazine of possibilities. It identifies, understands and analyzes the conflicts, morals, energies and opportunities of a changing Middle East and lays down possible futures.
item.content:encoded: The Outpost is a magazine of possibilities. It identifies, understands and analyzes the conflicts, morals, energies and opportunities of a changing Middle East and lays down possible futures.

item.content:encoded: A small selection of children's illustration work for various personal and promotional projects, and for exhibitions.

item.title: Outpost
item.description: Set in the remote and harsh high desert landscape of Idaho, Outpost is an artist live/work studio and sculpture garden for making and displaying art. An important aspect of the complex is the protected paradise garden, which is separated from the wild landscape by thick masonry walls. The materials used in the structure, including concrete block, car-decking, and plywood, require little to no maintenance, and are capable of withstanding the extreme weather that characterize the deserts four seasons. Outposts compactness limits site impact and reinforces the desire to be outside. The architects chose a readily available construction material concrete block for the primary structure; commercial builders were able to quickly and cheaply assemble the building. Interior materials are left largely unfinished. In a windy environment, the enclosed garden provides protection to develop a cultured space. Nothing outside the walls is modified. The footprint of the building is the limit of intrusion into the landscape a simple, clearly defined space within the landscape.
item.content:encoded: Set in the remote and harsh high desert landscape of Idaho, Outpost is an artist live/work studio and sculpture garden for making and displaying art. An important aspect of the complex is the protected paradise garden, which is separated from the wild landscape by thick masonry walls. The materials used in the structure, including concrete block, car-decking, and plywood, require little to no maintenance, and are capable of withstanding the extreme weather that characterize the deserts four seasons. Outposts compactness limits site impact and reinforces the desire to be outside. The architects chose a readily available construction material concrete block for the primary structure; commercial builders were able to quickly and cheaply assemble the building. Interior materials are left largely unfinished. In a windy environment, the enclosed garden provides protection to develop a cultured space. Nothing outside the walls is modified. The footprint of the building is the limit of intrusion into the landscape a simple, clearly defined space within the landscape.

item.title: NOKIA PURE / TYPOGRAPHY BOOK
item.description: The book,Twenty-Six Characters, details how Nokia's new typeface, Nokia Pure, was designed and developed by typographer Bruno Maag. The book is also design inspiration, a specimen sheet and a rough guide to typography. My contribution lies within the inspiration chapter, playfully exploring the usability and versatility of the font.
item.content:encoded: The book,Twenty-Six Characters, details how Nokia's new typeface, Nokia Pure, was designed and developed by typographer Bruno Maag. The book is also design inspiration, a specimen sheet and a rough guide to typography. My contribution lies within the inspiration chapter, playfully exploring the usability and versatility of the font.

item.title: Thuys at the Dolhuys
item.description: Dutch Studio Overtreders W redesigned the museum restaurant of Het Dolhuys, a museum focusing on the subject of psychiatry. The custom designed furniture was produced by clients of a psychiatric institution. The restaurant of Museum Het Dolhuys has a new interior and a new name: Thuys (Dutch for At Home). The new interior was designed by studio Overtreders W. The restaurant is based in the oldest part of the museum complex, the 14th century chapel of the original psychiatric hospital. The original function of the chapel was emphasized during the renovation, by painting the walls white and removing the plaster from the tower of the church, in which a childrens play corner was made. Among the eye-cathers of the restaurant are the counter covered with matt glazed tiles, a huge chandelier of metal boxes covered with wool felt and a modular wall system consisting of bookcases, picture frames, a panel for hanging the frames on the wall, acoustic panels and colour patches. These objects were designed with consideration for the specific qualities of people with psychiatric problems. These people are often very good at repetitive work that others would think of as boring. Therefore, the individual elements of the wall system and the boxes of the chandelier are very simple to produce, and were made by clients of two psychiatric institutions. The amount of different elements combined together make a rich and colourful whole. The sizes are based on DIN A paper sizes, to make sure all elements fit together. Some objects from the old interior returned in a new shape: the oak of an old bench was used to make a long table, the big second-hand lampshades were flocked in grey velvet and are in use again. The graphic design was made by Raw Color. pictures by Jorn van Eck
item.content:encoded: Dutch Studio Overtreders W redesigned the museum restaurant of Het Dolhuys, a museum focusing on the subject of psychiatry. The custom designed furniture was produced by clients of a psychiatric institution. The restaurant of Museum Het Dolhuys has a new interior and a new name: Thuys (Dutch for At Home). The new interior was designed by studio Overtreders W. The restaurant is based in the oldest part of the museum complex, the 14th century chapel of the original psychiatric hospital. The original function of the chapel was emphasized during the renovation, by painting the walls white and removing the plaster from the tower of the church, in which a childrens play corner was made. Among the eye-cathers of the restaurant are the counter covered with matt glazed tiles, a huge chandelier of metal boxes covered with wool felt and a modular wall system consisting of bookcases, picture frames, a panel for hanging the frames on the wall, acoustic panels and colour patches. These objects were designed with consideration for the specific qualities of people with psychiatric problems. These people are often very good at repetitive work that others would think of as boring. Therefore, the individual elements of the wall system and the boxes of the chandelier are very simple to produce, and were made by clients of two psychiatric institutions. The amount of different elements combined together make a rich and colourful whole. The sizes are based on DIN A paper sizes, to make sure all elements fit together. Some objects from the old interior returned in a new shape: the oak of an old bench was used to make a long table, the big second-hand lampshades were flocked in grey velvet and are in use again. The graphic design was made by Raw Color. pictures by Jorn van Eck

item.title: BBC Olympics 2012 - Stadium UK
item.description: The Olympic games was set to be the biggest moment in the nations sporting history and our objective was to ensure audiences appreciated the value that the BBC brought to this momentous occasion through its coverage of the Games across TV, radio, online, mobile, red button and HD, demonstrating its innovative approach to pan-media coverage. We aimed to showcase the innovative multi-channel accessibility of the Olympics coverage and firmly establish the BBC as THE Olympic broadcaster, by focussing on the insight that the BBC made the Olympics a truly inclusive experience, ticket or no ticket, because with the BBC Youre all invited wherever you are in the UK. We created a cutting-edge 3D animation, directed by Pete Candeland and scored by Elbow to showcase modern Britain. We took the Olympic sports out to the far reaches of the UK to demonstrate that wherever you were in the UK, the BBC gave you a front row seat to the Olympics.
item.content:encoded: The Olympic games was set to be the biggest moment in the nations sporting history and our objective was to ensure audiences appreciated the value that the BBC brought to this momentous occasion through its coverage of the Games across TV, radio, online, mobile, red button and HD, demonstrating its innovative approach to pan-media coverage. We aimed to showcase the innovative multi-channel accessibility of the Olympics coverage and firmly establish the BBC as THE Olympic broadcaster, by focussing on the insight that the BBC made the Olympics a truly inclusive experience, ticket or no ticket, because with the BBC Youre all invited wherever you are in the UK. We created a cutting-edge 3D animation, directed by Pete Candeland and scored by Elbow to showcase modern Britain. We took the Olympic sports out to the far reaches of the UK to demonstrate that wherever you were in the UK, the BBC gave you a front row seat to the Olympics.

Art Director: Stefan Sagmeister Design: Jessica Walsh, Joe Shouldice, Jong Woo Si Photographer (Girls inside bags): Henry Hargreaves Illustration: Jonathan Puckey, Jessica Walsh (Based on Jonathan Puckey's Dulaney Raster)

item.title: Banquet still life series
item.description: These Banquet still life series were created by conflicting feelings of melancholy and abundant energy. The process reminds me of how I used to craft in my girls room when I was little. Making monkeys hung on a transparent string in a jar. And then going to my mother and telling her, look mom the monkey floats!
item.content:encoded: These Banquet still life series were created by conflicting feelings of melancholy and abundant energy. The process reminds me of how I used to craft in my girls room when I was little. Making monkeys hung on a transparent string in a jar. And then going to my mother and telling her, look mom the monkey floats!

item.title: JJ's Red Hots
item.description: A brand new restaurant concept, heavily inspired by classic hot dog joints in Buffalo, NY and all over the great US of A. I worked closely with owner Jon Luther and his core team over the course of nearly a year to develop the entire JJ's visual identity. The comprehensive program included all the printed collateral, content managed website, apparel for retail and staff, interior/exterior signage, interior graphics, promotion strategy and the POS. It was a comprehensive undertaking and a true privilege to be a part of launching this brand.
item.content:encoded: A brand new restaurant concept, heavily inspired by classic hot dog joints in Buffalo, NY and all over the great US of A. I worked closely with owner Jon Luther and his core team over the course of nearly a year to develop the entire JJ's visual identity. The comprehensive program included all the printed collateral, content managed website, apparel for retail and staff, interior/exterior signage, interior graphics, promotion strategy and the POS. It was a comprehensive undertaking and a true privilege to be a part of launching this brand.

item.title: City Rising (Timelapse)
item.description: With City Rising I wanted to bring others up to this perspective, and from here, show them the city as they have never seen it before where the boundary between earth and sky is unclear and the placid beauty of the city lays spread out below, quietly humming along. City Rising takes the viewer straight through rush hour traffic to the highest urban peaks and the clouds above it all, all in under four minutes.
item.content:encoded: With City Rising I wanted to bring others up to this perspective, and from here, show them the city as they have never seen it before where the boundary between earth and sky is unclear and the placid beauty of the city lays spread out below, quietly humming along. City Rising takes the viewer straight through rush hour traffic to the highest urban peaks and the clouds above it all, all in under four minutes.

item.title: Steidl - International Photography Program Catalogues
item.description: International Photography biannual photo-book catalogues, featuring artists such as Robert Frank, Philip-Lorca diCorcia, William Eggleston, Lewis Baltz, Henry Wessel, Roni Horn, Ed Ruscha and Jim Dine, as well as the Nobel Prize winning authors Gu?nter Grass and Halldór Laxness. I was editor-in-chief, in charge of the Art Direction, photography and brand imagery of the International Photography Program. Acted as principal liaison between artists, designers, museums, galleries, editors and curators. Developed new concepts, themes and creative/editorial directions, working directly with artists and publisher Gerhard Steidl on new book titles. This project was designed, produced and printed in-house at Steidl Verlag in Gottingën, Germany.
item.content:encoded: International Photography biannual photo-book catalogues, featuring artists such as Robert Frank, Philip-Lorca diCorcia, William Eggleston, Lewis Baltz, Henry Wessel, Roni Horn, Ed Ruscha and Jim Dine, as well as the Nobel Prize winning authors Gu?nter Grass and Halldór Laxness. I was editor-in-chief, in charge of the Art Direction, photography and brand imagery of the International Photography Program. Acted as principal liaison between artists, designers, museums, galleries, editors and curators. Developed new concepts, themes and creative/editorial directions, working directly with artists and publisher Gerhard Steidl on new book titles. This project was designed, produced and printed in-house at Steidl Verlag in Gottingën, Germany.

item.title: LSTK Clarendon FREE FONT DOWNLOAD!
item.description: LSTK Clarendon As promised, another free font - and what a sweeeet one! This is our handlettered badass version of the english slab serif typeface, Clarendon. And because we don't want anyone to be lonely, we release it in two (!!!) styles, BOLD and OUTLINE. Use it, abuse it! Seriously! GO make bold stuff.
item.content:encoded: LSTK Clarendon As promised, another free font - and what a sweeeet one! This is our handlettered badass version of the english slab serif typeface, Clarendon. And because we don't want anyone to be lonely, we release it in two (!!!) styles, BOLD and OUTLINE. Use it, abuse it! Seriously! GO make bold stuff.

item.title: IPG Mediabrands Homepage
item.description: Interface Design for the new IPG Mediabrands Homepage. The homepage cityscape background is changing depending on the users location, showing a city with an IPG office nearby. Also the current time and weather conditions for this city are displayed. (This feature will be available in version 2.0 of the live page)

item.title: Sony Music Timeline
item.description: Sony Music Timeline The Sony Music Timeline celebrates 125 years of musical history covering almost 150 square meters of wall space in Sonys Derry Street headquarters. Using just CNC cut vinyl as the sole medium, 54 columns measuring over 2 meters tall cover feature nearly 1000 of Sony Music's signed artists from 1887 to the present day. Emma Pike, VP Industry Relations, who commissioned the piece said, The brief was to bring the inspiration of our music into the heart of our building and make our office space live and breathe our incredible musical legacy. Alexs beautiful graphics and illustrations do exactly that.
item.content:encoded: Sony Music Timeline The Sony Music Timeline celebrates 125 years of musical history covering almost 150 square meters of wall space in Sonys Derry Street headquarters. Using just CNC cut vinyl as the sole medium, 54 columns measuring over 2 meters tall cover feature nearly 1000 of Sony Music's signed artists from 1887 to the present day. Emma Pike, VP Industry Relations, who commissioned the piece said, The brief was to bring the inspiration of our music into the heart of our building and make our office space live and breathe our incredible musical legacy. Alexs beautiful graphics and illustrations do exactly that.

item.title: Suntec City
item.description: A monumental fountain ringed by restaurants and cafes anchors a new civic space in a downtown Singapore district once lacking in street life.
item.content:encoded: A monumental fountain ringed by restaurants and cafes anchors a new civic space in a downtown Singapore district once lacking in street life.

item.title: Book "De Madrid al Palace"
item.description: De Madrid al Palace es un homenaje al Palace, emblemático hotel de Madrid, que este 2012 cumple 100 años. Ilustado por fernando Vicente, con textos de Fernando Royuela, por sus páginas aparecen diferentes personajes que, con motivo de sus viajes a la capital española, eligieron al Palace para hospedarse. A través de sus páginas podremos descubrir anécdotas curiosas de Mick Jagger, Borges, Michael Jackson, Einstein, entre muchos otros ilustres personajes.
item.content:encoded: De Madrid al Palace es un homenaje al Palace, emblemático hotel de Madrid, que este 2012 cumple 100 años. Ilustado por fernando Vicente, con textos de Fernando Royuela, por sus páginas aparecen diferentes personajes que, con motivo de sus viajes a la capital española, eligieron al Palace para hospedarse. A través de sus páginas podremos descubrir anécdotas curiosas de Mick Jagger, Borges, Michael Jackson, Einstein, entre muchos otros ilustres personajes.

item.title: Ogopogo
item.description: Ogopogo is an exciting start-up that brings the gift experience concept to the Croatian market. Ogopogo allows you to choose from a selection of destinations and activities within a given theme. It consists of a gift box containing a brochure, with details of each activity and a voucher to redeem the selected experience. Bunch developed the Ogopogo brand, including naming, tagline, visual identity, website and the product design which features bold visuals hand crafted with paper cut-out models built by Tena Letica and beautifully photographed by Mladen Šari?. Great attention to detail was applied in production stages, especially in paper choice, to ensure that the tactility of paper models extends to the product.
item.content:encoded: Ogopogo is an exciting start-up that brings the gift experience concept to the Croatian market. Ogopogo allows you to choose from a selection of destinations and activities within a given theme. It consists of a gift box containing a brochure, with details of each activity and a voucher to redeem the selected experience. Bunch developed the Ogopogo brand, including naming, tagline, visual identity, website and the product design which features bold visuals hand crafted with paper cut-out models built by Tena Letica and beautifully photographed by Mladen Šari?. Great attention to detail was applied in production stages, especially in paper choice, to ensure that the tactility of paper models extends to the product.
